text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm and today i'm going to show you how
to make scallops and arugula with
lentils and butter beans very delicious
very easy so healthy
here is a pound of scallops i buy the
frozen wild chemical-free scallops make
sure you check the label on the bag I
should just say ingredients and scallops
I'm gonna add a little bit of olive oil
some cayenne pepper some sweet paprika a
little bit of black pepper and then a
big pinch of salt I'm gonna toss those
so they're all coated with olive oil now
the secret here is the scallops will be
coated in oil but I'm gonna cook them in
a dry pan by the way you're gonna pull
off that little muscle see that it's
called the foot and it's called the foot
because it well doesn't really look like
a foot but it actually holds the scallop
onto the shell and it can be very tough
now I missed a couple to be honest with
you when I prep these and it was funny
because when I ate them they were just
as tender as a scallop but usually
they're tough so I would try to pull
them off if you can and they just peel
right off the side no big deal so you're
gonna put those in a dry saute pan on
high heat very important it's high heat
because if it's not high heat you won't
get this nice sear on them if it's low
heat or medium heat they'll just start
to boil cuz they're all water and you'll
have boiled scallops now it's good
although I hear that's big in England
okay that was for my friend Brian
alright so what we're gonna do here is
we're going to sear those about three
minutes on each side
and you're gonna see that little

not really caramelize ation it's
something I forgot the name of my lard
effect or something like that anyway
maybe I'll write about it in the post
I'm gonna take those out of the pan
they're gonna rest in a bowl while I
cook the rest of the ingredients which
is just gonna take like two three
minutes in the same pan I'm gonna turn
the heat down to medium said I want my
delicious scallop juices burning all
right I'm gonna add in a whole clove of

gonna pull out those big chunks later
it's just gonna season the beans I'm
gonna dump in the juice of a lemon and a
12 ounce jar of rinsed but not

night totally drained I just rinsed off
the beans and I didn't let them really
drain thoroughly so there's a little bit
of water on the bean which helps to
glaze the pan
combines with the lemon juice and the
garlic and a little bit of oil that was
on the scallop and really really gets
those beans so delicious they'll kind of
get a little bit of golden-brown you
want to be careful not to burn them of
course it's a very off flavor but you
should be fine on medium heat so that
only went for about a minute I'm gonna
dump in about a cup and a half of cooked
lentils
I had them leftover you could just boil
some lentils some stores actually sell

gonna throw in a couple handfuls of baby

because if it has like an exploding
bright spicy flavor the other story is
because the Romans considered it an
aphrodisiac
but then again what didn't the Romans
considered an aphrodisiac and I'm just
gonna let that wilt for about 30 seconds
and I'm going to pour in the reserved

sitting in that bowl for a couple
minutes and it has just this lovely
sweet liquor as the French would say so
I'm gonna put the liquor from the

the kind of braising process here and
this whole thing is almost in real time
it only takes a couple minutes I'm gonna
dump my scallops back in just so those
are nice and warm and because I didn't

and taste this for salt and pepper and
we are just about ready to roll so I'm

really really nice I'm gonna put on some
